resources.string: is protected. Please enter the pin to authenticate.

Please make sure that you have started the Remote Control Server on the PC that you want to control.

You can download the server at:
http://server.android-remote.com

If your PC doesn\'t show up here, manually add the IP address and make sure that your devices are connected to the same network.\n\nYou can find advanced troubleshooting instructions in the help section.
Control your mouse cursor like on a laptop touchpad
Use your software keyboard to type on your PC
Common actions to easily browse the web remotely
See your PC screen right on your device in real time
Control presentations and check your slide content
Quick access for frequently used Windows shortcuts
Use your voice to send commands to your PC
Control common media players and your system volume
Define custom actions in the Remote Control Server
Unlocks all premium remotes and upcoming features
You will find shortcuts and function keys here soon.
Get or activate an unlock code
You can unlock the premium features for free by activating unlock codes.\n\nSome codes are only valid for a limited time, some won\'t expire. Trial codes can only be activated once.
Purchased upgrades won\'t expire and will be unlocked on all your devices.\n\nAny upgrade will also remove ads.

You can get a free trial code from our Facebook page to get you started.

To receive your code, navigate your PC's browser to:
http://code.android-remote.com

If you sign up as a beta tester on Google+, you will also get a free trial code.

To receive your code, navigate your PC's browser to:
http://beta.android-remote.com
Watching an ad will unlock all premium remotes for one session.\n\nThis option may won\'t be available every time.
This remote is a pro feature. You can activate an unlock code or purchase an upgrade to use it.
Available for Android, BlackBerry and iOS.\nCopyright © Steppschuh, license details at:\nremote-control-collection.com
Available for Windows. The source code is available at GitHub and may be modified for private use.\nCopyright © Steppschuh, license details at:\ngithub.com/Steppschuh/RemoteControlServer
All icons are either released under an Attribution 4.0 International license by Google Inc. or by Steppschuh.

This app uses Google Analyitcs to collect anonymous usage data, including your language, gender, age and which remotes you preferably use. This helps us to improve your experience when using this app.
AdMob is an advertising service provided by Google Inc. that allows us to display interest based ads in order to monetize the free app. Ads will be removed by any paid upgrade.
To start controlling your PC, open this website on the device that you want to control:\n\nhttp://setup.android-remote.com
Follow this guide to learn how to setup a connection between your devices.
If you are having issues following the setup guide, read this to learn how to fix common issues.
Questions related to this app or the Remote Control Server might have been already answered. You can also add your questions here.
If you are having any issues, feel free to contact us. We will get back to you as soon as possible.\n\nPlease do us a favor and read the guides and FAQ before reaching out to us.
Let us know what you think, your feedback is what helps us improving this app!
The device name may not be empty
Please enter the IP address of your PC
Please enter a valid IP address
This is not a valid code
Something went wrong, please try again.
The registration limit of this code has been reached.
This code expired, you can\'t activate it anymore.
You have already used a trial code, you may only activate one code per device.
In-app billing is not supported on this device.

This app version requires the Remote Control Server version 3.0 or newer.

Please update your Server or download the latest version from:
http://server.android-remote.com
